verbose_text: Gucukoglu and Kuplulu reported that higher ripening temperatures (26degreesC versus 22degreesC) potentiated the reduction of putrescine by different starter cultures (L. sakei + S. xylosus B-FM, L. plantarum + S. carnosus TD66, and L. curvatus + S. carnosus + S. xylosus RM-10) in experimental Turkish fermented sausages.
evidence: Gucukoglu and Kuplulu               reported that higher ripening temperatures (26degreesC versus 22degreesC) potentiated the reduction of putrescine
